profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-02-14 13:54:03 -0500.

did.abstract: This collection contains files related to the work of Professor Sheldon Krimsky, Lenore Stern Professor of Humanities and Social Sciences in the Tufts Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning from 1974-2022. Records relate to his teaching and his work with professional organizations, including the founding of the Council for Responsible Genetics, between 1967-2021.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in five series: Course records; Research notes and lectures; Council for Responsible Genetics history; Correspondence; and Meeting records and research papers.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Professor Sheldon Krimsky (1941-2022) was the Lenore Stern Professor of Humanities and Social Sciences in the Tufts Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning from 1974 until 2022.

Sheldon Krimsky, also known as Shelly, was born on June 26, 1941, in Brooklyn, New York, and died April 23, 2022, in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Professor Krimsky held a B.S. in physics and math from Brooklyn College, an M.S. in physics from Purdue University, as well as an M.A. in philosophy and a Ph.D. in the philosophy of science from Boston University. He lived between Cambridge and New York City, teaching at Tufts University for 47 years, as well as serving as a visiting professor at Columbia University, Brooklyn College, the New School, and New York University. Krimsky was a fellow of the American Association for the Advancement of Science and of the Hastings Center on Bioethics. Further, he served on the National Institutes of Health's National Recombinant DNA Advisory Committee, as a consultant for the Office of Technology Assessment, and was a co-founder of the Council for Responsible Genetics. He also held positions on the editorial boards of several scientific publications, and published and co-authored numerous books and articles of his own.

Professor Krimsky was married to Carolyn Boriss-Krimsky. The couple had two children, Alyssa Krimsky Clossey and Eliot Krimsky, as well as three grandchildren. Sheldon Krimsky died at the age of 80 in Cambridge, Massachusetts on April 23, 2022.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Tufts Archival Research Center website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish.Â Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Laurel Williams, Administrative Assistant for Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning, 2022, accession UA-2023-036.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sheldon Krimsky Papers, 1967-2021. Tufts University. Tufts Archival Research Center. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing was completed by Kate McNally, Records and Accessioning Archivist, in 2023. Received order and creator-supplied folder titles were retained, though series were imposed. Where no original title existed, the archivist devised a title based on the content of the folder. Materials were placed in archival folders where needed. A folder-level inventory and the finding aid were created at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains course records, research and lecture notes, historical files related to the Council for Responsible Genetics, correspondence, meeting records, and research papers. The bulk of the materials date from 1967 to 1992, and were produced through the work of Professor Sheldon Krimsky, Lenore Stern Professor of Humanities and Social Sciences in the Tufts Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning from 1974-2022. Krimsky was active in numerous professional organizations and was a co-founder of the Council for Responsible Genetics. Materials related to these activities are well represented in the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning Records, 1978 -- 2021. Tufts University. Tufts Archival Research Center. Medford, MA.
Council for Responsible Genetics Records, 1983 -- 2014. Tufts University. Tufts Archival Research Center. Medford, MA.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Travel reimbursement documents containing personally identifiable information were removed from the collection and securely destroyed in February 2023.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trustees records are open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains research notes and transcripts of lectures delivered by Professor Krimsky. The materials date from approximately 1971 to 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence between Sheldon Krimsky and various colleagues, organizations, and personal acquaintances related to his research, publishing, speaking engagements, and a variety of other topics. The materials date from 1973 to 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, research project files, literature reviews, writings, and conference materials created and used by Sheldon Krimsky in his work with various scientific and professional organizations. The materials date from 1985 to 1992.
